subject: Re: Subscribe sticky footer
preview: Hi Theo,I can't seem to replicate the issue. Please see the attached. Can you send the link where this is showing up? and what browser are you using?

full_threads.body:
Hi Theo,

I can't seem to replicate the issue. Please see the attached. Can you send the link where this is showing up? and what browser are you using?

Hi guys,

I noticed the subscribe sticky footer changed layout.

Could we do it back as it was before where the subscribe and submission field is next to each other?

Many thanks!

Theo

Hi Theo,

Sure, all good now, we have adjusted the "talk to us" widget. 
https://belance.com.au/

Thanks Joel that's a lot better.

Just noticed on mobile though it pushed the "Talk to Us" widget up (see attached). Can that be changed to where it was before as it looks a bit strange...

Thanks,

Theo

Hi Theo,

Confirming we have adjusted the line-heights to make it thinner. please see the attached file.

Thanks Joel, and can we just make it thinner and smaller font?

Thanks,

Theo

Hi Theo,

Sure, I have disabled the sticky  on the mobile. Let me know fi this works for you?  
https://belance.com.au/

Hi Joel,

Yes that's good! Could we just make it smaller and thinner like you did before?

I do think it takes too much space on the mobile version though so would it be possible to have disabled for mobile? Or see how it looks a lot thinner and smaller?

Thanks,

Theo

Hi Theo,

We have updated the subscribe section. I made some changes on the footer. Let me know if this works for you? 
https://belance.com.au/

Hi Theo,

You can edit the text through this link. https://belance.com.au/wp-admin/post.php?post=11522&action=elementor#
I'll get back to you regarding the disappearing of the sticky when it comes to bottom of the page.

Thank you Joel!

Where do I go to edit the text?

Is it possible to disable on mobile? And also make it disappear when the visitor scrolls to the very bottom of the page?

Theo

Hi Theo,

Confirming we have added a subscribe sticky. Let me know if this works for you?
https://belance.com.au/

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi guys,

Would it be easy to do a type of thin sticky footer on the page?

Something like the attached photo, very thin and simply has "subscribe". This would follow people as they scroll down and disappear once at the bottom?

Cheers,

--
Theodore English
